_header: Hail Jesu my creator of sorrowing medecine
Subjects: Christ, hymns to; hymns, to Christ
_description: A hymn to Jesus — seven mono-riming quatrains with medial rhymes

BodDonC13.First Lines:
Haile Ihesu my creator of sorou þou est medicyneHaile Ihesu my
                    saueor þou suffrid for me mykil pyne…
BodDonC13.Last Lines:
…þou len me myȝt as þou wele may deboner for to
                    belat neuer my langing wende away vnto I be with þe
BodDonC13.Note:
4 stanzas. At the start of the poem in the margin:
                    ‘peccator’. Cf. 6812, which Greene (1977)
XGreene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon, 1977 (see
            also Greene (1935)
XGreene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977), 361 identifies
                    as derived from this text.

Brown,  Beatrice Daw. 
             “Religious Lyrics in MS. Don. c.13.” 
             Bodleian Quarterly Record
         7 (1932): 1-7 plus frontispiece facsimile of f. 166: facing 1.

CULDd564.First Lines:
hEyle ihesu my creatowre of sorowyng medicyne Heyle ihesu mi
                    saueowre þat for me sufferd pyne…
CULDd564.Last Lines:
…Þi luf es fast in ilk a fandyng & euer at al owre
                    nede Als thurgh þi grace art my ȝhernyng In til þi lyght me
                    lede
